results.title: L'atalante [study extract]
results.brief_description: An extract from the last film directed by Jean Vigo, which tells the story of a young skipper of a barge who takes on board his newly-wed country girl, and their slow trip up the Seine towards Paris. The film relates their early love, disillusion, separation and final reconciliation. This extract deals with their separation. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: L'Ange
results.creator_credit: Patrick Bokanowski, INA France and Kira BM Films
results.brief_description: This amazing marriage of art, music and film took five years (1977-1982) in the making by its French creator, Patrick Bokanowski and programmed non-stop in a Tokyo cinema for nearly ten years. The impressionistic images are accompanied by a beautiful atmospheric soundtrack of original music composed by Michele Bokanowski to present a textured, multi-layered complexity of vision and sound. “L’Ange” makes for compelling viewing and deserves its cult status in the world of avant-garde filmmaking. Cast includes Jacques Faure, Martine Couture, Jean-Marie Bon, Dominique Lesourd, Maurice Baquet, Rita Renoir, Patricia Peretti.

results.title: L'africaine
results.creator_credit: Lotfi Mansouri, Robert Walker, KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.), RM Arts and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: L’Africaine, recorded live from the San Francisco Opera, is conducted by Maurizio Arena. The story tells how Vasco da Gama sails to find a new land beyond Africa and is shipwrecked on the African coast. He returns to Portugal with two captives Nelsuko and Selika. He has fallen in love with Selika but she finally sacrifices her life so that da Gama can marry his former love, Ines. Music by Giocomo Meyerbeer. Stars Shirley Verrett and Placido Domingo.

results.title: Kyushu: Japan's island of wonders
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: Travelogue on Kyushu, the southern-most of Japan’s four main islands. While drawing brief attention to Japan’s expanding industrial capacity and intensive agricultural practices, the film is designed with the purpose of encouraging western tourists. Thus, it catalogues a wealth of familiar recreational pursuits, eg golf; the medicinal benefits of the numerous thermal springs and the exotic charm of Hakkata porcelain.

results.title: Kyoto: ancient capital of Japan
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: Shows the city of Kyoto, built when Japan was under the greatest influence of China. From 1794 to 1868 it was the capital city of Japan, and today is the 1100 years old cradle of Japanese art, science and culture - a city of temples, palaces and universities and the centre for research in physics, philosophy and oriental studies. It is renowned for ceramic handicrafts, porcelain, modern Japanese painting, silk weaving and beautiful brocades.

results.title: Kylie: intimate & live
results.creator_credit: Mark Adamson, David Wilson and Mushroom Records Pty. Limited
results.brief_description: Join popular Australian performer Kylie Minogue on her recently successful Australian tour. Kylie is recorded live at the Capitol Theatre in Sydney, July 1st 1998 and performs hits from her past (Stock, Aitken and Waterman days) and present career including; “Too far”, “What do I have to do?”, “Some kind of bliss”, “Put yourself in my place”, “Breathe”, “Take me with you”, “I should be so lucky”, “Dancing Queen”, “Dangerous game”, “Cowboy style”, “Step back in time”, “Say hey”, “Free”, “Drunk”, “Did it again”, “Limbo”, Shocked”, “Confide in me”, “Locomotion”, “Should I stay or should I go?” and “Better the devil you know”. Includes candid interviews with the support crew including costuming, backing vocals and fellow performers.

results.title: Kutlwanong: a place of hearing
results.creator_credit: David C. Oosthuizen and South Africa. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: Story of the Rustenberg Dutch Reformed Church School for the deaf, mute, and blind. Tells how an unwanted young Tswana girl finds herself and achieves a secure place, not only in her family, but in the community. The emotional reaction of the young girl who hears for the first time in her life is a feature of this film.

results.title: Kurt Vonnegut Jr: a self portrait
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: The world famous science fiction writer Kurt Vonnegut, Jnr, speaks candidly about his self-discovery as a writer, his themes and his special vision of American life. His comments are enlightening and provide the viewer with at times, a very amusing self portrait of a major American literary figure.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities

results.title: Kurosawa [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Adam Low, Margaret Smilow, Sonoko Bowers, BBC-TV, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Thirteen and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Kurosawa: A documentary on the acclaimed director by Adam Low explores the genius of Kurosawa’s filmmaking in the post-war environment of Japan. The documentary affirms the volatile socio-political environment in Japan at the time affecting Kurosawa’s work and why Kurosawa came to such notable recognition for his films in Japan and throughout the world. The synergy of Kurosawa and actor Toshiro Mifune is explored as well as his relationship with long time associate Teruyo Nogami. The documentary features extended clips from Kurosawa’s films including: “Sanshiro sugata”, “The Most beautiful”, “The Men who tread on the tiger’s tail”, “No regrets for our youth”, “Drunken angel”, “Rashomon”, “Ikiru”, “Seven samurai”, “Throne of blood”,”Yojimbo”, “Red beard”, “Dodes’ka-den”, “Dersu uzala”, “Kagemusha”, “Ran”,”Dreams”, “Madadayo”. Includes interviews with: James Coburn, Clint Eastwood, Machiko Kyo, Isuzu Yamada, Tatsuya Nakadai, Kon Ichikawa, Tadao Sato and Donald Richie. Narrated by Sam Shepard. English and Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Kung fu as a folk art
results.creator_credit: Ban Hoe, Pierre Stevens, Roland Pirker and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An art, a self-discipline, a martial skill, a philosophy, the ancient Chinese tradition of Kung Fu is all of these. This film follows a class of novices at a Canadian school of Kung Fu through to the completion of their three-year course.
